news_header: North Korea claims to have found a South Korean military drone in Pyongyang, escalating tensions between the two countries.
news_text: North Korea released photos of what it claims are the remains of a South Korean military drone found in Pyongyang, asserting it was used to drop propaganda leaflets. The North's state media reported that the drone was discovered during a search on October 13 and that its investigation confirmed it originated from South Korea. While South Korea initially denied sending drones, it later stated it would not respond to North Korea's claims. Analysts noted the drone appears to be a long-range reconnaissance model used by the South Korean military. Tensions are rising on the Korean Peninsula, with North Korea threatening retaliation for any drone incursions and escalating military activities from both sides.
